If x³-9=-17, then x³-9+9=-17+9, which is x³=-8. 3√ of x³ is x, 3√ of -8 is -2  on the 4th question, we can negate the square root by squaring both sides, which leaves us x³+9=36, x³+9-9=36-9, x³=27, x=3
@b52stealthbomber25  why in 4th case x isnt =x⁵?  as we know in (x³)² its just be = x⁵
@b52stealthbomber25  bro isn,t 17+8=26 so how is it 8.3
​ @randompersonsfather6077  that's negative 17
@dephin2052  bro the ^2 got rid of the square root so it's gone after that.
​ @dephin2052  The ^2 canceled out the square root
1.) X³ - 9 = -17  Add Positive 9 to both sides X³ = -8  Take the Cube Root of both sides to cancel out the exponent X = -2

First cube everything to get ride of the cube root. This leaves us with x^2 + 15 = 64. Subtract 15 from both sides leaving x^2 = 49. Take the square root of both sides and you get x = 7, -7.

but instead you cube it to cancel it out?
@czar2074  Which problem did you think you had to square? The same one he squares at 3:51 or a different one?
Nala Roe ok so the comprehension part the question that has a 3 outside I thought I had to square it cause on 3:51 he does that but instead I had to cube it correct?

@czar2074  Yes. That's what that 3 outside it means. If the root symbol doesn't have any number on the corner (like at 3:51) it's a square root, if it does have a number then that number tells us what sort of root it is. Because it's a cube root in the comprehension question we have to cube both sides to get ride of it. Does that make sense?
Nala Roe yes it does thanks!
@czar2074  Happy to help 😊

@czar2074    √ = ^2√  He raises it the power of 2 because when there's nothing there, it's an assumed 2.  ^3√ would need to be raised to the power of 3  ^4√ would need to be raised to the power of 4  That's why you raise the third question to the power of 3.
